description.raw:
Add `//model/@canonical_link` attribute that specifies the name of the model's canonical link, to which the model's implicit frame is attached. If unset, the first link in the model is chosen. This is based on the following section of the proposal:

* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#2-model-frame-and-canonical-link

It implies that a model must have at least one link. A new error code is added for this case and tested with example sdf files.

`ign sdf --check` also checks that the canonical_link attribute matches a link in the model and has tests.
description.html:
Add //model/@canonical_link attribute that specifies the name of the model's canonical link, to which the model's implicit frame is attached. If unset, the first link in the model is chosen. This is based on the following section of the proposal:

  • http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#2-model-frame-and-canonical-link

It implies that a model must have at least one link. A new error code is added for this case and tested with example sdf files.

ign sdf --check also checks that the canonical_link attribute matches a link in the model and has tests.

title.raw: [Citadel] sdf 1.7: add `//model/@canonical_link` attribute and require models to have at least one link
title.html: [Citadel] sdf 1.7: add //model/@canonical_link attribute and require models to have at least one link
